intro: Piper interitum, commonly known as the Indian pepper or wild pepper, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Piper interitum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
